author: pcgeek86
body:
On the Docker Hub, there are automated builds for Linux container images, however there's no container image to run PowerShell Core on the Windows platform. We should provide a new container image tag for `microsoft/powershell:nano`, or similar.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/466713/20677890/eadc47ac-b551-11e6-84b3-d2d9f29b2711.png)

Cheers,
**Trevor Sullivan**
Docker Captain
Microsoft MVP: Cloud & Data Center Management
https://trevorsullivan.net
https://twitter.com/pcgeek86

comments.author: brycem
comments.body: Correct - We have Dockerfiles to install the current Powershell release here:  https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docker/release.  No nightly\daily build support yet.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @brycem are you working on getting nightly/daily build support?

comments.author: brycem
comments.body: Before I I left on vacation, @raghushantha and I were blocked on a Win10Sdk bug.  Looks like they may have a private fix to take a look at.  Have you done this already Raghu?

comments.author: brycem
comments.body: @TravisEz13, @raghushantha  - The Jenkins deployment would be an easy place to automate the build process for these images going forward:  https://azopenci.westcentralus.cloudapp.azure.com/ - We have Windows and Ubuntu docker hosts.

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: @brycem The build is already automated.  Let's please discuss this offline.

title: Add Windows container image for PowerShell Core
